Question.S: A group of thunderstorms which develop in a line one next to the other each in a different stage of development are called:
Severe thunderstorms are different from air-mass thunderstorms in that severe thunderstorms:

Answer.S: E) have a tilted updraft in the mature stage

L.S: D) have a strong updraft and downdraft
E) have a tilted updraft in the mature stage
A) have very little cloud-to-ground lightning
B) have updraft velocities that exceed 100 miles per hour

Question.S: Downdrafts spread throughout a thunderstorm during the ____ stage.
Air mass thunderstorms only last about one hour and begin to dissipate when:

Answer.S: C) when the downdraft spreads throughout the cloud and cuts off the updraft

L.S: A) lightning neutralizes all the electrical charge in the cloud
B) when all the precipitation particles in the cloud turn to ice
C) when the downdraft spreads throughout the cloud and cuts off the updraft
D) when solar heating at the ground begins to decrease

Question.S: Describe the atmospheric conditions at the surface and aloft that are necessary for the development of most supercell thunderstorms. (Include in your answer the role that the lowlevel jet plays in the rotating updraft.)

Answer.S: In a region where there is strong vertical wind shear as might be caused with the existence of a low-level jet the thunderstorm may form in such a way that the outflow of cold air from the downdraft never undercuts the updraft. In such a storm the wind shear may be so strong as to create horizontal spin which when tilted into the updraft causes it to rotate. A large long-lasting thunderstorm with a single violently rotating updraft is called a supercell. It is the rotating aspect of the supercell that can lead to the formation of tornadoes.

Question.S: In an eastward moving thunderstorm the most likely place for a tornado to develop is in the ____ part of the storm.

Answer.S: A storm containing lightning and thunder.

Question.S: The name given to a towering cloud that has not fully developed into a thunderstorm is:
What atmospheric conditions are necessary for the development of ordinary cell thunderstorms?

Answer.S: Warm humid air masses away from significant weather fronts.
